summary: This bill, the Right to Contraception Act, aims to protect an individual's right to access and use contraceptives, and a healthcare provider's right to provide related services and information. It defines contraception and contraceptive, outlines findings related to contraception access, and specifies permitted services. The bill asserts that no law should restrict the sale, provision, or use of contraceptives. It also establishes a private right of action to challenge violations of these rights and includes enforcement mechanisms. According to the bill, this Act supersedes and applies to federal and state laws, and takes effect immediately upon enactment.
